metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5140 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Image for moz-icons can be accessed through the "moz-icon:" protocol through script in web content even when otherwise prohibited. This could allow for information leakage of which applications are associated with specific MIME types by a malicious page. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 59.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5140` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
